Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.board

Class Tile

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.board.Tile
public class Tile
extends java.lang.Object
Class that represents a tile, the single slot of the board. It holds reference to the proprietary board and has various information stored.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description

    Constructor.

  • Constructor Details

    • Tile

      public Tile​(int a, int b, Board currentBoard)
      Constructor.
      Parameters:
      a - Row index of the board.
      b - Column position of the board.
      currentBoard - Reference to the board.

  • Method Details

    • initNeighbors

      public void initNeighbors()
      Initializes every tile's neighbor

    • setBuildingLevel

      public void setBuildingLevel​(int buildingLevel) throws NotBuildableException
      Set the new building level of the tile. Must be between 0 and 3.
      Parameters:
      buildingLevel - Level to set the level of the building to.
      Throws:
      NotBuildableException - The given value of building level was invalid.

    • setDome

      public void setDome​(boolean dome)
      Set whether there is the dome or not.
      Parameters:
      dome - True if there is a dome, false if not.

    • setWorker

      public void setWorker​(Worker worker)
      Sets the reference to the worker positioned in the tile.
      Parameters:
      worker - Reference to the worker.

      Returns reference to the worker positioned in the tile.
      Returns:
      Reference to the worker (if present).

    • deleteWorkerAndOwner

      public void deleteWorkerAndOwner()
      Sets the reference of the worker to NULL.

    • hasWorker

      public boolean hasWorker()
      Returns true whether there is a worker on this tile.
      Returns:
      True if there is a worker on this tile, false if not.

    • hasDome

      public boolean hasDome()
      Returns true if there is a dome on this tile.
      Returns:
      True if there is a dome on this tile, false if not.

    • isWalkable

      public boolean isWalkable()
      Returns true if the selected worker can move on this tile.
      Returns:
      True if it's possible to move on this tile.

    • isBuildable

      public boolean isBuildable()
      Returns true if the player can build in this tile.
      Returns:
      True if the worker can build in this tile.

    • buildUp

      public Tile buildUp() throws NotBuildableException
      Adds 1 building level to the tile, returns true if the action was successful.
      Returns:
      Reference to the tile used.
      Throws:
      NotBuildableException - Thrown if it was not possible to build on this tile.

    • buildDown

      public Tile buildDown() throws NotBuildableException
      Deletes 1 building level to the tile, returns true if the action was successful.
      Returns:
      Reference to the tile used.
      Throws:
      NotBuildableException - Thrown if it was not possible to build on this tile.

    • getNeighbors

      public java.util.ArrayList<Tile> getNeighbors()
      Returns a list of the neighbors.
      Returns:
      List with reference to all the 8 neighbors of this tile.

    • getNeighborsOptimized

      public java.util.ArrayList<Tile> getNeighborsOptimized()

    • getWalkableNeighbors

      public java.util.List<Tile> getWalkableNeighbors() throws NoWalkableTilesException
      Returns a list of only the neighbors where the worker can move to.
      Returns:
      List of only the neighbors where the worker can move to.
      Throws:
      NoWalkableTilesException - There are no tiles where the worker can move to.

    • getBuildableNeighbors

      public java.util.List<Tile> getBuildableNeighbors() throws NoBuildableTilesException
      Returns a list of only the neighbors where the worker can build on.
      Returns:
      List of only the neighbors where the worker can build on.
      Throws:
      NoBuildableTilesException - There are no tiles where the worker can build on.

    • isMovableTo

      public boolean isMovableTo​(Tile from, Tile dest, int moveUpMax, int moveDownMax)
      Return true if it is possible to move from the first tile to the second, given the limits of the movement.
      Parameters:
      from - Starting tile.
      dest - Arrive tile.
      moveUpMax - Limit of building level for "up" movement
      moveDownMax - Limit of building level for "down" movement
      Returns:
      true if the worker can move, false otherwise

    • getMovableToNeigh

      public java.util.List<Tile> getMovableToNeigh​(int moveUpMax, int moveDownMax)
      Returns a list of tiles where a worker can move to, starting from this tile.
      Parameters:
      moveUpMax - Limit of building level for "up" movement
      moveDownMax - Limit of building level for "down" movement
      Returns:
      List of tiles where a worker can move to.
